paper.title: Portfolio Optimization Under The Framework Of Reinforcement Learning
paper.abstract: Portfolio management is an art and science of making decisions about the investment mix and policy, that matching investments to objectives, assets allocation for the individuals and institutions, balancing risk against performance. In this paper, a neural network is used to train and analysis the history of the assets as well as their portfolio weights for each asset and later evaluate the potential growth for the immediate future under the reinforcement learning(RL) framework, which is based on the recent reinforcement learning(RL) developments, testing is carried with the historical data from cryptocurrency exchange market, camparison with other framework shows that the framework based on RL behaved far better than most other optimization framework in the test period.

domain_result.justification: The paper focuses on using reinforcement learning and neural networks to optimize portfolio management by analyzing historical asset data and portfolio weights, with the goal of evaluating potential growth. This directly aligns with the field of Portfolio Management, as it involves decision-making about investment mix and asset allocation to balance risk and performance.
